page.title: 01EARL STERNDALE
page.content: {Earl Sterndale}is a small village in the Peak District of Derbyshire. It lies at an altitude of 1100 feet above sea level on the limestone plateau. Around the village are scattered farms and the hamlets of{Hurdlow Town, {Pomeroy}and{Sterndale Moor. The village lies close to the valley of the River Dove, which is the county boundary. Farming and quarrying are the main industries,and there is a haulage firm in the village. Facilities are minimal: there is a Church, Chapel,pub and Post Office/Shop in the village.
